parameters.name: AttachTypes
parameters.description:
The additional type of the vulnerabilities. You need to specify this parameter when you query application vulnerabilities. Set the value to **sca**. If you set **Type** to **app**, you must specify this parameter.

> If you set this parameter to **sca**, application vulnerabilities and the vulnerabilities that are detected based on software component analysis are queried. If you do not specify this parameter, only application vulnerabilities are queried.

parameters.name: CurrentPage
parameters.description: The number of the page to return. Default value: **1**.

parameters.name: Dealed
parameters.description:
Specifies whether the vulnerabilities are fixed. Valid values:

*   **y**: yes
*   **n**: no

parameters.name: GroupId
parameters.description:
The ID of the asset group.

> You can call the [DescribeAllGroups](~~DescribeAllGroups~~) operation to query the IDs of asset groups.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Default value: **zh**. Valid values:

*   **zh**: Chinese
*   **en**: English

parameters.name: Necessity
parameters.description:
The priority to fix the vulnerability. Separate multiple priorities with commas (,). Valid values:

*   **asap**: high
*   **later**: medium
*   **nntf**: low

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of NextToken. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries per page. Default value: **10**.

parameters.name: Remark
parameters.description: The remarks for the asset affected by the vulnerability. The value can be the private IP address, public IP address, or name of the asset.

parameters.name: ResourceDirectoryAccountId
parameters.description:
The Alibaba Cloud account ID of the member in the resource directory.

>  You can call the [DescribeMonitorAccounts](~~DescribeMonitorAccounts~~) operation to obtain the IDs.

parameters.name: StatusList
parameters.description:
The status of the vulnerability. Separate multiple statuses with commas (,). Valid values:

- 1: unfixed
- 2: fix failed
- 3: rollback failed
- 4: being fixed
- 5: being rolled back
- 6: being verified
- 7: fixed
- 8: fixed and to be restarted
- 9: rolled back
- 10: ignored
- 11: rolled back and to be restarted
- 12: not found
- 20: expired

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description:
The type of the vulnerability. Valid values:

*   **cve**: Linux software vulnerability
*   **sys**: Windows system vulnerability
*   **cms**: Web-CMS vulnerability.
*   **app**: application vulnerability that is detected by using web scanner
*   **emg**: urgent vulnerability.
*   **sca**: application vulnerability that is detected by using software component analysis

parameters.name: UseNextToken
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to use NextToken to query the data of vulnerabilities. If you set UseNextToken to true, the value of TotalCount is not returned. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

parameters.name: Uuids
parameters.description: The UUIDs of the servers on which you want to query the vulnerabilities. Separate multiple UUIDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: VpcInstanceIds
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) in which the vulnerabilities are detected. Separate multiple IDs with commas (,).
